intro: Acinodendron stylosum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in small umbels. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
